pageContext.claim: “I got briefed on it yesterday [Kellyanne Conway’s violations of the Hatch Act] and it looks to me like they're trying to take away her right of free speech. And that's just not fair. They asked a question. If her -- I think one of them was involved with your show. But you ask them a question, or you ask a person a question and every time you're supposed to say, I can't answer, I can't answer.”
pageContext.analysis: A federal government watchdog recommended that Conway be fired for repeated violations of the Hatch Act, which bars employees of the federal government from engaging in political activity in the course of their work. The watchdog agency called Conway's behavior "unprecedented," citing numerous media interviews in which she disparaged Democrats seeking to challenge Trump in 2020. “Her defiant attitude is inimical to the law, and her continued pattern of misconduct is unacceptable,” the agency wrote. But Trump says Conway was exercising her free speech rights and declined to impose a punishment.
